metadata.title: CVE-2021-37592 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
Suricata before 5.0.8 and 6.x before 6.0.4 allows TCP evasion via a clientwith a crafted TCP/IP stack that can send a certain sequence of segments.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-37592` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

suricata - 1:6.0.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: suricata package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:6.0.4-1').
